body_html: I am concerned about the overheads comment at the top of the pull. Pascals are quite a bit faster and if we pull in the pooling, batchnorm, dropout cudnn functions, things will continue to get faster on the GPU and overheads on the CPU will become more exposed. Most of the tuning work we find ourselves doing in the frameworks now is CPU (and IO) tuning work.

body: I am concerned about the overheads comment at the top of the pull.  Pascals are quite a bit faster and if we pull in the pooling, batchnorm, dropout cudnn functions, things will continue to get faster on the GPU and overheads on the CPU will become more exposed.  Most of the tuning work we find ourselves doing in the frameworks now is CPU (and IO) tuning work.
